articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, in the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong Wednesday on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of her demise.
					 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were senior party, army and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, leading officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and the Korean Internal Security Forces and working people and school youth and children in the city.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet were placed before the bust.
					
					 Placed then before the bust were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, KPA units, educational, public health and media institutions, the joint national organization of the Korean Children's Union, party and power organs, factories, farms, etc. in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Suk, looking back on her noble life through which she made immortal contributions to accomplishing the sacred cause of liberating the country and achieving national prosperity as the closest comrade and a soldier most loyal to President Kim Il Sung and carved out a rosy future for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 On the same day, floral baskets were laid before her statues in Kim Jong Suk County, Hoeryong City and at Kim Jong Suk Naval University and Kim Jong Suk General Military Academy.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Graves of Grandparents of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Graves of Grandparents of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik and Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok in Mangyongdae on the Harvest Moon Day.
					 Seen standing before the graves were wreaths sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Kim Yong Chun, Choe Thae Bok, Vice-Premiers Pak Su Gil and Han Kwang Bok, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and working people in the city.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet were placed before the graves.
					
					 Placed then before them were wreaths in the name of ministries and national institutions, military universities, educational and media institutions, revolutionary schools and party and power organs and farms in the city.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Po Hyon, Ri Po Ik, Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Different Martyrs Cemeteries
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Different Martyrs Cemeteries
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery on Wednesday on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day.
					 Seen standing on the wreath-laying stands were wreaths sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present there were senior party, army and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Laid there were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Placed then were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, units of the KPA, ministries and national institutions, educational, cultural, art, public health and media institutions and party and power organs, enterprises and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the martyrs who dedicated themselves to the country's liberation, freedom and happiness of the people, victory in the drive to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation, the country's independent reunification and the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 On the same day wreaths were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery in Hyesan and cemeteries and graves of martyrs in different areas in the name of local party and power organs, working people's organizations, factories, enterprises, farms, schools, etc.

Directors' Board.

articles.title: Rehabilitation Brisk in Flood-afflicted Areas
articles.content:
Rehabilitation Brisk in Flood-afflicted Areas
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Some areas of the DPRK were hard hit by torrential rain and typhoon No. 7 in August and early in September.
					 Many dwelling houses, public establishments and production-related buildings and some roads, bridges and railroads, etc, in North Phyongan, Kangwon, Jagang and South Hwanghae provinces and other areas were destroyed or submerged and farmlands came under silt or washed away
					
					 Rehabilitation is now brisk in these areas.
					
					 Rehabilitation commands were formed in the relevant provinces. They are now dynamically pushing ahead with the work to bring the living of the population there to normal as soon as possible while giving priority to the supply of cement, structural steel and other materials.
					
					 North Phyongan Province is now more qualitatively reconstructing the destroyed structures including the objects directly related to the people's living.
					
					 People in Kangwon and Jagang provinces have rebuilt dwelling houses and public establishments and reconstructed seriously damaged various sections of railroads and roads cut off by landslide, ensuring the smooth train service and road traffic.
					
					 Meanwhile, officials and working people in the fields of power distribution, post and tele-communication and water supply and drainage in the afflicted areas succeeded in restoring the destroyed power network, post and tele-communication and water service facilities in a short span of time through a dynamic campaign.
					
					 Water pumps in different counties of South Hwanghae Province including Jaeryong, Sinchon and Kangryong counties have operated at full capacity, drawing out dead water from thousands of hectares of inundated paddy and non-paddy fields. A work is also making rapid progress to rehabilitate set-ups in rivers and streams.

articles.title: Feats for Building of Revolutionary Armed Forces
articles.content:
Feats for Building of Revolutionary Armed Forces
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Korean people, on the occasion of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk's death anniversary, September 22,  are looking back upon what she did for the building of revolutionary armed forces.
					 After the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule, she, upholding President 
						Kim Il Sung's idea on the founding of an army, visited Pyongyang Institute many times to guide it to fully discharge its mission and duty for training military and political cadres.
					
					 She also frequented the Central Security Officers School and underscored the need to equip the cadets with the President's military ideas and war methods and tactics.
					
					 When the Korean People's Army (KPA) was founded, she put her heart and soul into making it undertake an appearance suitable for a regular army as early as possible.
					
					 She often visited the first tank unit of the KPA to take care of the tankmen's life and encourage them to train themselves properly so as to live up to public expectation. 
					
					 At a shipyard where Patrol Ship No. 51 was built, she called on its workers to lay down many patrol ships conducive to the strengthening of the navy. She also called at an arsenal several times for the production of quality weaponry with its own effort and technologies.
					
					Instructions she gave as regards the founding of the regular army total more than 420. 
					
					 The undying feats she performed in the strengthening of the revolutionary forces are shining in the history of Songun Korea.

articles.title: Harvest Moon Day
articles.content:
Harvest Moon Day
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The fifteenth day of the eighth lunar month is the Harvest Moon Day, one of the greatest folk holidays the Korean people have observed from long ago.
					 It is derived from a custom of the Koreans enjoying the full moon in autumn when the harvest of crops and fruits is plenteous.
					
					 According to historical records, they began enjoying the holiday in the early years of three kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje and Silla).
					
					 The first thing to be done in the day is to visit tombs of ancestors to weed them and hold memorial services with dishes prepared with new crops of the year.
					
					 Typical holiday dishes and drink are half-moon-shaped rice cake, rice cake seasoned with glutinous rice and malt flours, dumpling stuffed with chestnuts and wine made of glutinous rice.
					
					 Ssirum (Korean wrestling), swing, tug of war, handweaving and other amusements are popular that day.
					
					 In the evening, people climb hills or spread straw mats on their courtyards to look at the full moon, cherishing desires and reciting poems and singing songs reflecting their dreams. They also foresee the crop yield of the year from the brightness of the moon.
					
					 The custom has been carried forward to meet the requirement of the times and suit the Korean people's noble traits and feelings.

articles.title: End to S. Korean Anti-reunification Policy Urged
articles.content:
End to S. Korean Anti-reunification Policy Urged
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- It is impossible to achieve national reconciliation and unity and the cooperation and exchange between the north and the south nor is it possible to expect any progress in the movement for national reunification and peace on the Korean Peninsula as long as the south Korean conservative group is allowed to pursue its policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen, the policy intended to chill the south Korean people's desire for independent reunification and block the development of the movement for national reunification.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The above-said policy is a clear manifestation of the conception hostile to the compatriots and the root cause of sowing the seeds of antagonism and discord among Koreans and driving the inter-Korean relations to a collapse. It runs diametrically counter to the trend of the June 15 era of reunification and the desire of all Koreans for the improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The act of antagonizing compatriots is prompted by a treacherous attitude of considering compatriots as the targets of confrontation and aggression not as the objects for reconciliation and unity. Any act to do harm to compatriots, regarding them as an enemy, merely because of the differing ideology and system, cannot but spark off confrontation and military conflicts between the north and the south.
					
					 Should the south Korean authorities persistently pursue such despicable policy of confrontation as "no nukes, opening and 3,000 dollars" unanimously rebuffed and denounced by all Koreans, this will bring the distrust and confrontation between the north and the south into a bottomless mire and finally drive the inter-Korean relations into an inescapable collapse.
					
					 It admits of no further argument that the south Korean authorities' behavior of depending on the cooperation with outside forces and giving priority to them is quite contrary to the trend of the June 15 era of reunification. 
					
					 It is the desire of the times and wishes of the people to see a switchover in the policy of confrontation with compatriots in south Korea.
					
					  Should its ruling forces stand in the way of improving the inter-Korean relations, persistently pursuing the above-said policy, they will not be able to escape the fate of being rebuffed and condemned by history and the people for being traitors to the nation.

articles.title: Thorough Probe into Truth about "Cheonan" Called for
articles.content:
Thorough Probe into Truth about "Cheonan" Called for
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The final report released by the puppet Ministry of Defence on the deceptive "Cheonan" case came under strong criticism from different circles of south Korea. 
					 Opposition parties including the Democratic Labor Party held that the above-mentioned final report is only adding to the doubts about the case, far from helping probe the truth about it. They termed this window-dressing to cover up suspicions about the warship case.
					
					 The "joint action for a probe into the truth about Cheonan case and peace on the Korean Peninsula" grouping more than 40 civic and public organizations including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Solidarity for Progress and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea in its statement urged the military group to open to the public all information about the case and punish the chief culprit  and demanded the "National Assembly" promptly conduct inspection of state administration.
					
					 The Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society declared that the final report released by the Ministry of Defence only caused the public reliability to further sink. It demanded a thorough probe into the truth about the warship case through the inspection of state administration.
					
					 Meanwhile, more than 1,160 people from all walks of life in Seoul filed a lawsuit in the Seoul Administrative Court on Sept. 17 demanding the puppet minister of Defence and the chairman of the Audit and Inspection open the information about the case to the public.

articles.title: Actions against Anti-Workers Policy Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against Anti-Workers Policy Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions at a meeting in Seoul on Sept. 16 vowed to struggle against the puppet authorities' policy against workers.
					 The organization reiterated its will to intensify its actions to have the issue of part-time jobs and the issue of re-amending the law on trade unions, etc. settled by carrying forward the spirit of Martyr Jon Thae Il who burnt himself to death in protest against the dictatorial regime.  
					
					 The organization declared that it would carry on its actions to foil the crackdown upon the union, force the Lee Myung Bak regime to step down, halt the projects for the improvement of the four large rivers and win back the right to existence and boost the solidarity and alliance with progressive forces.
					
					 It, at the same time, declared that it would conduct dynamic activities for achieving the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula with the 3rd anniversary of the publication of the October 4 declaration at hand.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Suk en el dia de su fallecimiento
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Suk en el dia de su fallecimiento 
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 61o aniversario del fallecimiento de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, tuvo lugar este miercoles una ceremonia de homenaje ante su busto en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong.
					Estaba depositada alli la ofrenda floral enviada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los cuadros del partido, el ejercito y el Estado, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios directivos de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las entidades de masas, los ministerios y los organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, los trabajadores, estudiantes y ninos capitalinos.
					
					Han sido colocadas ante el busto de  Kim Jong Suk las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC.
					
					Seguidamente, fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales a nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, las entidades de masas, los ministerios, los organos centrales, las unidades del EPC, las instituciones de educacion, salud publica, prensa e informacion, la Junta Nacional de Organizaciones de la Union de Ninos de Corea, los organos del partido  el Poder, las fabricas y granjas en la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio recordando la valiosa vida de la Heroina quien hizo imborrable aporte al cumplimiento de la sagrada causa para la liberacion de la patria y la prosperidad de la nacion siendo camarada mas intima y fiel del Presidente Kim Il Sung y trajo el porvenir maravilloso de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Por otra parte, ese dia tuvieron lugar los mismos actos al pie de sus estatuas de bronce erguidas en el distrito Kim Jong Suk, la ciudad de Hoeryong, la Universidad Naval Kim Jong Suk y la Escuela Integral de los Oficiales Kim Jong Suk

articles.title: Colocadas ofrendas florales ante tumbas de patriotas en Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Colocadas ofrendas florales ante tumbas de patriotas en Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo de Chusok (15 de agosto lunar), fueron colocadas el dia 22 las ofrendas florales ante las tumbas de Kim Po Hyon, Ri Po Ik, Kim Hyong Jik y Kang Pan Sok en Mangyongdae.
					 Estaban colocadas en esos lugares las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					 En la ceremonia de homenaje estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Nam, Kim Yong Chun, Choe Thae Bok, los vicepremieres Pak Su Gil y Han Kwang Bok, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, organizaciones de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					 Fueron colocadas las ofrendas florales a nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC.
					
					 Tambien, fueron depositadas las ofrendas a nombre de los ministerios, los organos centrales, las academias militares, las instituciones de educacion y prensa, las escuelas revolucionarias, los organos del partido y el poder y las granjas en esta capital.
					
					 Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los fervientes patriotas arriba mencionados.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a martires con motivo de Chusok
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a martires con motivo de Chusok
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo de Chusok (15 de agosto lunar), fueron depositadas el dia 22 las ofrendas florales ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong y el de Patriotas.
					 Estaban puestas alli las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					 En las ceremonias de homenaje participaron los cuadros del partido, el ejercito y el Estado, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las entidades de masas, los ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea y los trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					 Fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC.
					
					 Acto seguido, fueron colocadas las ofrendas florales a nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, las unidades del EPC, los ministerios, los organos centrales, las instituciones de educacion, cultura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, los organismos del partido y el poder, empresas y granjas en la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					 Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires quienes dedicaron todo lo suyo por la liberacion de la patria, la libertad y felicidad del pueblo, por el triunfo de la construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista y por la reunificacion de la patria y la coronacion de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					 Este dia, tuvieron lugar las mismas ceremonias en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios de Hyesan y los cementerios y tumbas en diferentes localidades.
					
					 En las ocasiones han sido depositadas las ofrendas florales a nombre de las instituciones del partido y el poder, las entidades de masas, fabricas, empresas, granjas y escuelas, etc. de las respectivas localidades.

articles.title: Se intensifica en Corea la reparacion de secuelas de desastres naturales
articles.content:
Se intensifica en Corea la reparacion de secuelas de desastres naturales
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Como consecuencia de la lluvia torrencial y el tifon no.7 ocurridos en agosto y a principios de septiembre, varias regiones de Corea sufrieron grandes danos.
					 En las provincias de Phyong-an del Norte, Kangwon, Jagang, Hwanghae del Sur y otras zonas fueron destruidos y sumergidos numerosas viviendas, edificios publicos y de produccion, unas carreteras, puentes, ferrocarriles, etc.
					
					  Igualmente, el terreno cultivable ha sido inundado, rellenado y desprendido.
					
					  Las provincias instauraron los puestos de mando de reconstruccion para estabilizar cuanto antes la vida de los habitantes de zonas afectadas anteponiendo el suministro de materiales necesarios como el cemento y el acero.
					
					  En la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte se reconstruyen con mas calidad las construcciones destruidas incluyendo los objetos relacionados directamente con la vida del pueblo.
					
					  Los habitantes de las provincias de Kangwon y Jagang reconstruyeron las viviendas y los edificios publicos, por una parte, y, por la otra, restablecieron los ferrocarriles destruidos seriamente en varios tramos y las carreteras averiadas por el derrumbe de montana posibilitando asi la circulacion de trenes y coches.
					
					  Ademas los funcionarios y trabajadores de las ramas de transmision y distribucion de energia electrica, la comunicacion y el acueducto y alcantarillado de las zonas afectadas repararon en corto plazo lo que ha sido perjudicado de sus respectivos dominios.
					
					  En Jaeryong, Sinchon, Kangryong y otros distritos de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur se aceleran con dinamismo el drenaje del agua estancada en miles de hectareas de arrozal y campo inundadas poniendo en pleno funcionamiento las bombas de agua y la reparacion de las instalaciones de los rios.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica la politica de enfrentamiento fratricida
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica la politica de enfrentamiento fratricida
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Mientras este vigente la politica de confrontacion fratricida de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos, que frustra la aspiracion de los habitantes a la reunificacion independiente e impide el desarrollo del movimiento por la reunificacion de la patria, no se puede lograr la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion ni la cooperacion y el intercambio entre ambas partes coreanas. Y tampoco se puede esperar el desarrollo del movimiento por la reunificacion de la patria ni la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					 Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido en su edicion de este miercoles y continua:
					
					 La politica conflictiva de las autoridades surcoreanas es una evidente expresion de su hostilidad a la connacional RPDC y la causa de antagonismo y discordia que lleva a la ruptura las relaciones intercoreanas. Por lo tanto, contraviene completamente a la corriente de la epoca de reunificacion iniciada el 15 de junio y a la aspiracion de toda la nacion a la mejora de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					 Hostigar a los compatriotas es una actitud antinacional que toma a los consanguineos como blanco de enfrentamiento y agresion, en lugar de verlos como contraparte de reconciliacion y unidad. 
					
					 Si se pretende atacar a ellos tomandolos como enemigos por tener diferentes ideologias y regimenes, no se puede evitar la confrontacion y los conflictos armados entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					 Si las autoridades surcoreanas siguen practicando la politica de confrontacion como "la desnuclearizacion, la apertura y 3000 dolares", repudiada por toda la nacion, creceran cada dia mas la desconfianza y la confrontacion entre el Norte y el Sur y no podran salir del actual estado caotico las relaciones bilaterales. 
					
					 Es indiscutible que las maniobras de las autoridades surcoreanas, que anteponen la cooperacion con las fuerzas extranjeras poniendolas en el primer lugar, contravienen a la corriente de la epoca de reunificacion del 15 de Junio. 
					
					 En el Sur de Corea el cambio de la politica de confrontacion fratricida ha sido la demanda de la epoca y del pueblo. 
					
					 Si las autoridades gobernantes surcoreanas siguen impidiendo el mejoramiento de las relaciones N-S obstinandose en su politica conflictiva, seran condenadas por la historia y la nacion como traidoras a la nacion.
